para.text: The data that can be specified for the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package are the
. The user can also choose what data to print about the unsaturated zone for the cells whose values are set by the object that is being edited.
are explained in the help for the
is the infiltration rates (L/t) at land surface for each vertical column of cells. If the
is specified as being greater than the vertical hydraulic conductivity then the
is set equal to the vertical unsaturated hydraulic conductivity. Excess water is routed to streams or lakes when
is the evapotranspiration (ET) demand rate (L/t) within the ET extinction depth interval for each vertical column of cells.

, is the depth below land surface below which ET does not occur. The quantity of Evapotranspiration (ET) removed from a cell is limited by the volume of water stored in the unsaturated zone above the extinction depth. If groundwater is within the ET extinction depth, then the rate removed is based on a linear decrease in the maximum rate at land surface and zero at the ET extinction depth. The linear decrease is the same method used in the
is the water content below which ET cannot be removed from the unsaturated zone. The
must have a value between (Saturated_Water_Content-Sy) and Saturated_Water_Content, where Sy is the specific yield specified in either the LPF or BCF Package.
